current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide for an integrated plan for the space launch activities of the Federal
			 Government.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Integrated Space Launch Policy Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Integrated Space Launch Policy Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Integrated plan on space launch activities of the Federal Government

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall jointly, in coordination with the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, and the heads of other appropriate agencies of the Federal 
			 Government, develop a plan (to be
			 known as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of the Office of Science and Technology
			 Policy

quote.#tail:
)  to achieve the effective planning, coordination, and execution of  the civilian and national
			 security space launch activities of
			 the Federal Government in order to ensure that the mission needs of the
			 Federal Government for reliable, timely, and affordable access to space
			 are met in a
			 cost-effective manner.

text.#text: The plan developed under subsection (a) shall include, at a minimum, the following:

An estimate of the anticipated annual space launch demand of the Federal Government during the 10
			 fiscal
			 years beginning with the fiscal year beginning in the year in which the
			 plan is developed.

A description of the capabilities required to meet the demand estimated for purposes of paragraph
			 (1).

A description of the acquisition plans of each Federal agency covered by the plan for purposes of
			 meeting the demand estimated for purposes of paragraph (1).

An identification and assessment of opportunities for coordination among Federal
			 agencies in space launch acquisition efforts, and a summary of the lessons
			 learned by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is currently achieving assured access to space with
			 its space launch in a manner consistent with the provisions of

shall
			 jointly submit the plan developed under subsection (a) to the
			 appropriate committees of

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

The plan shall be submitted in unclassified form, but may
			 include a classified annex.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall submit to
			 the appropriate committees of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Comptroller General of the United States

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a report setting forth an
			 assessment of the adequacy of the plan developed under subsection (a),
			 including the extent to which the plan includes the launch needs and
			 capabilities of the civilian agencies and the national security agencies 
			 of the Federal Government.
